line_1: In all disputes, on either part he lied,
line_2: And freely pledged his oath on either side;

line_1: He drank, he swore, he jested, and he lied;
line_2: 'T was not less sudden; in the night he died,

line_1: The self-same spot, or Virgil ly'd,
line_2: On which the good Anchises dy'd;

line_1: E'er he could prove the good Squire ly'd.
line_2: Patrige is Dead, nay more, he dy'd
